<document xmlns="http://dlmf.nist.gov/LaTeXML" class="ltx_authors_1line ltx_leqno">
  <resource src="LaTeXML.css" type="text/css"/>
  <resource src="ltx-article.css" type="text/css"/>
  <resource src="ltx-amsart.css" type="text/css"/>
  <title>Approximating
gradients with continuous piecewise polynomial functions</title>
  <toctitle>Piecewise polynomial approximation of gradients</toctitle>
  <creator role="author">
    <personname>Andreas Veeser</personname>
    <contact role="email">Andreas.Veeser@unimi.it</contact>
    <contact role="url">http://www.mat.unimi.it/users/veeser/</contact>
  </creator>
  <date name="Date:" role="creation">November 30, 2018</date>
  <abstract name="Abstract.">
    <p>Motivated by conforming finite element methods for elliptic problems of second
order, we analyze the approximation of the gradient of a target function by
continuous piecewise polynomial functions over a simplicial mesh. The main
result is that the global best approximation error is equivalent to an
appropriate sum in terms of the local best approximations errors on elements.
Thus, requiring continuity does not downgrade local approximability and
discontinuous piecewise polynomials essentially do not offer additional
approximation power, even for a fixed mesh. This result implies error bounds in
terms of piecewise regularity over the whole admissible smoothness range.
Moreover, it allows for simple local error functionals in adaptive tree
approximation of gradients.</p>
  </abstract>
  <keywords name="Key words and phrases">Approximation of gradients, continuous piecewise polynomials,
finite elements, Lagrange elements, discontinuous elements,
a priori error estimates, adaptive tree approximation</keywords>
  <classification name="1991 Mathematics Subject Classification" scheme="1991 Mathematics Subject Classification">41A15, 41A63, 41A05, 65N30, 65N15</classification>

    <toctitle><tag close=" ">1</tag>Introduction</toctitle>
<!--  %**** String Line 50 **** -->    <para xml:id="S1.p1">
      <p>Finite element methods are one of the most successful tools for the
numerical solution of partial differential equations. In their
simplest form they are Galerkin methods where the discrete space is
given by elements that are appropriately coupled. This piecewise
structure allows to construct bases that are, on one hand, relatively
easy to implement and, on the other hand, are locally supported. The
latter leads to linear systems with sparse matrices, which can be
stored and often solved with optimal linear complexity.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p2">
      <p>This article concerns the approximation properties of continuous
piecewise polynomial functions over a simplicial mesh, which build a prototype
finite element space. It analyzes the interplay of global and local best
errors when approximating the gradient of a target function.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p3">
      <p>Continuous piecewise polynomial functions arise when solving elliptic boundary
value problems of second order with Lagrange elements (see §<ref labelref="LABEL:S:Poly"/> for
a definition). To be more specific, if the associated bilinear form is
<Math mode="inline" tex="H^{1}_{0}(\Omega)" text="(H ^ 1) _ 0 * Omega" xml:id="S1.p3.m1">

      <equation labels="LABEL:local-best-errors" xml:id="S1.Ex2">
        <Math mode="display" tex="e_{K}(u){:=}\inf\big{\{}{\left\|{{\nabla}(u-p)}\right\|_{{K}}}\mid p\in{%&#10;\mathcal{P}_{{\ell}}({{K}})}\big{\}},\qquad\forall{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}." xml:id="S1.Ex2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

            </XMApp>
            <XMWrap>
              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

            </XMWrap>
            <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
            <XMTok meaning="infimum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">inf</XMTok>
            <XMWrap>
              <XMTok fontsize="120%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR" xml:id="S1.Ex2.m1.2">∇</XMTok>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok name="mid" role="VERTBAR">∣</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Ex2.m1.3">K</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
              <XMTok fontsize="120%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
            </XMWrap>
            <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="20.0pt">,</XMTok>
            <XMTok meaning="for-all" name="forall" role="BIGOP">∀</XMTok>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
            <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
            <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>The question arises how the global and local best errors are related and how
their relationship is affected by requiring conformity.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p4">
      <p>In the described context the main result Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:elm-dec"/> reads as
follows. For any conforming mesh, the global best error is equivalent to the
appropriately collected local best errors. More precisely, there holds</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:equivalence" xml:id="S1.E2">
        <tags>
          <tag>(1.2)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">1.2</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="\left(\sum_{{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}}e_{K}(u)^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\leq E(u)\leq&#10;C%&#10;\left(\sum_{{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}}e_{K}(u)^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}," text="((sum _ (K element-of M))@(e _ K * u ^ 2)) ^ (1 / 2) less= E * u less= C * ((sum _ (K element-of M))@(e _ K * u ^ 2)) ^ (1 / 2)" xml:id="S1.E2.m1">

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>

                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.E2.m1.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.E2.m1.2">u</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.E2.m1.4.2"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="true">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S1.E2.m1.4.2">
                            <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                              <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S1.E2.m1.3"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.E2.m1.3">u</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="true">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok mathstyle="script" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="S1.p4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> can be bounded in terms of the shape regularity of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}" text="M" xml:id="S1.p4.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The
first inequality in (<ref labelref="LABEL:equivalence"/>) is straight-forward and just a
quantitative version of the motivation that suggests to introduce the local
best errors. The second inequality, which is not obvious and the proper
concern of this paper, means that the above requirements for conformity
essentially do not downgrade the approximation potiential given by the local
discrete spaces. It thus confirms in particular the coupling via continuity of
the elements.
Adopting the broken <Math mode="inline" tex="H^{1}" text="H ^ 1" xml:id="S1.p4.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-seminorm as error notion, there is a second
interpretation of (<ref labelref="LABEL:equivalence"/>): discontinuous and continuous piecewise
polynomial functions have essentially the same approximation power. We also
derive variants of (<ref labelref="LABEL:equivalence"/>) addressing the coupling of partial
derivatives of the approximants and mesh conformity; see Theorem
<ref labelref="LABEL:T:pder-dec"/> and Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:n-elm-dec"/>, respectively.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p5">
      <p>The second inequality in (<ref labelref="LABEL:equivalence"/>) is proved in
§<ref labelref="LABEL:S:ConformityImpact"/> by means of suitable local error bounds for a
continuous interpolant. As interpolant, one can use a variant of the
Scott-Zhang interpolant <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Scott.Zhang:90" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> or averages like in S. Brenner
<!--  %**** String Line 150 **** --><cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Brenner:96" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> of local best approximations. The key ingredients for these
local error bounds are the Trace and Poincaré inequalities.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p6">
      <p>Equivalence (<ref labelref="LABEL:equivalence"/>) reduces the quantification of
the global best error to the quantification of decoupled, local best
approximation errors. We illustrate the usefulness of this aspect
with two applications in §<ref labelref="LABEL:S:appl"/>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p7">
      <p>First, the second inequality in (<ref labelref="LABEL:equivalence"/>) may be used in the
a priori analysis of finite element solutions. For example, inserting
the Bramble-Hilbert lemma in the right-hand side of (<ref labelref="LABEL:equivalence"/>), one
readily obtains the upper bound</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:apriori-ub" xml:id="S1.E3">
        <tags>
          <tag>(1.3)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">1.3</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="E(u)\leq C\left(\sum_{{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}}h_{K}^{2\ell}{\left\|{D^{\ell+1}u}%&#10;\right\|_{{K}}}^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}," text="E * u less= C * ((sum _ (K element-of M))@((h _ K) ^ (2 * ell) * ((norm@(D ^ (ell + 1) * u)) _ K) ^ 2)) ^ (1 / 2)" xml:id="S1.E3.m1">

                      <XMDual>

                            <XMApp scriptpos="mid">

                                    </XMApp>

        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="h_{K}" text="h _ K" xml:id="S1.p7.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> denotes the diameter of an element <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}" text="K element-of M" xml:id="S1.p7.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Notice that
the right-hand side involves only piecewise regularity and so vanishes whenever
<Math mode="inline" tex="u\in{S}" text="u element-of S" xml:id="S1.p7.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. This is also true for Lagrange interpolation error estimates,
but not for the available error bounds <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Clement:75,Scott.Zhang:90" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> for
<!--  %**** String Line 175 **** -->interpolation of non-smooth functions. Here it is obtained without invoking
the imbedding <Math mode="inline" tex="H^{\ell+1}\subset C^{0}" text="H ^ (ell + 1) subset-of C ^ 0" xml:id="S1.p7.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and so also under weaker regularity
assumptions on the target function <Math mode="inline" tex="u" text="u" xml:id="S1.p7.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p8">
      <p>Second, (<ref labelref="LABEL:equivalence"/>) can be applied in constructive nonlinear
approximation. When using the local best errors <Math mode="inline" tex="e_{K}(u)" text="e _ K * u" xml:id="S1.p8.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p8.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p8.m1.1">u</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as local error
functionals in the adaptive tree approximation of P.  Binev and R. DeVore
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Binev.DeVore:04" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, then equivalence (<ref labelref="LABEL:equivalence"/>) ensures that the
approximations, which are constructed with linear complexity, are near best
with respect to the <Math mode="inline" tex="H^{1}" text="H ^ 1" xml:id="S1.p8.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-seminorm.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:S:Poly" xml:id="S2">
    <tags>
      <tag>2</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§2</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">2</tag>Continuous piecewise polynomial functions and gradients</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">2</tag>Continuous piecewise polynomial functions and gradients</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S2.p1">
      <p>In this section we define the approximants, fix associated notation, and review
their relationship with gradients. We also provide a basis for them and, to
prepare interpolation, link the coefficients of that basis to the space of
target functions.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p2">
      <break/>
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega" text="Omega" xml:id="S2.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be a non-empty open set of <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbb{R}}^{d}}" text="R ^ d" xml:id="S2.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="d\in{\mathbb{N}}" text="d element-of N" xml:id="S2.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. As usual,
<Math mode="inline" tex="{L^{{2}}}(\Omega)" text="L ^ 2 * Omega" xml:id="S2.p2.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m4.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p2.m4.1">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> denotes the Hilbert space of real-valued functions on
<Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega" text="Omega" xml:id="S2.p2.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> that are measurable and square-integrable with respect to the Lebesgue
measure of <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbb{R}}^{d}}" text="R ^ d" xml:id="S2.p2.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="{H^{{1}}}(\Omega)" text="H ^ 1 * Omega" xml:id="S2.p2.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m7.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p2.m7.1">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the Hilbert space of all functions
that, together with their distributional gradients, are in <Math mode="inline" tex="{L^{{2}}}(\Omega)" text="L ^ 2 * Omega" xml:id="S2.p2.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m8.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p2.m8.1">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p3">
      <p>Given <Math mode="inline" tex="k\in{\mathbb{N}}" text="k element-of N" xml:id="S2.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="k\leq d" text="k less= d" xml:id="S2.p3.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, a set <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}" text="K" xml:id="S2.p3.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S2.p3.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-simplex in <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbb{R}}^{d}}" text="R ^ d" xml:id="S2.p3.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> if it
<!--  %**** String Line 200 **** -->is the convex hull of <Math mode="inline" tex="k+1" text="k + 1" xml:id="S2.p3.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> points <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{0},\dots,a_{k}\in{{\mathbb{R}}^{d}}" text="list@(a _ 0, dots, a _ k) element-of R ^ d" xml:id="S2.p3.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m7.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m7.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m7.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p3.m7.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.p3.m7.1">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p3.m7.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> that do not lie
on a plane of dimension <Math mode="inline" tex="k-1" text="k - 1" xml:id="S2.p3.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The set of extreme points of a convex set <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="S2.p3.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
is denoted by <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{Vert}C" text="Vert@(C)" xml:id="S2.p3.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">Vert</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. For example, there holds
<Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{Vert}{K}=\{a_{0},\dots,a_{k}\}" text="Vert@(K) = set@(a _ 0, dots, a _ k)" xml:id="S2.p3.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">Vert</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m11.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m11.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m11.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p3.m11.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.p3.m11.1">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p3.m11.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the definition of <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S2.p3.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-simplex. A
<Math mode="inline" tex="m" text="m" xml:id="S2.p3.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-simplex <Math mode="inline" tex="{F}" text="F" xml:id="S2.p3.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="m\in\{1,\dots,k\}" text="m element-of set@(1, dots, k)" xml:id="S2.p3.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m15.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m15.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m15.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p3.m15.1">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.p3.m15.2">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p3.m15.3">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a <Math mode="inline" tex="m" text="m" xml:id="S2.p3.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-face of <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}" text="K" xml:id="S2.p3.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> if
<Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{Vert}{F}\subset\operatorname{Vert}{K}" text="Vert@(F) subset-of Vert@(K)" xml:id="S2.p3.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">Vert</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">Vert</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. By convention, a vertex is a
<Math mode="inline" tex="0" text="0" xml:id="S2.p3.m19">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-face. As usual, <Math mode="inline" tex="h_{K}" text="h _ K" xml:id="S2.p3.m20">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> denotes the diameter of <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}" text="K" xml:id="S2.p3.m21">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, while
<Math mode="inline" tex="\rho_{K}" text="rho _ K" xml:id="S2.p3.m22">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> stands for the diameter of the largest ball in <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}" text="K" xml:id="S2.p3.m23">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The
boundary of any <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S2.p3.m24">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-simplex <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}" text="K" xml:id="S2.p3.m25">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbb{R}}^{d}}" text="R ^ d" xml:id="S2.p3.m26">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> can be represented locally by a
Lipschitz function. Hence the trace operator</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:TraceOp" xml:id="S2.E1">
        <tags>
          <tag>(2.1)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">2.1</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="(\cdot)_{|\partial{K}}:{H^{{1}}}({K})\to{L^{{2}}}(\partial{K})" text="cdot _ [|∂K] colon H ^ 1 * K to L ^ 2 * partial-differential@(K)" xml:id="S2.E1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.E1.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="cdot" role="MULOP" xml:id="S2.E1.m1.1">⋅</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMArg rule="Subscript">
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                </XMArg>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.E1.m1.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.E1.m1.2">K</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.E1.m1.3"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.E1.m1.3">
                        <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>is well-defined. Hereafter <Math mode="inline" tex="{L^{{2}}}(\partial{K})" text="L ^ 2 * partial-differential@(K)" xml:id="S2.p3.m27">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m27.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p3.m27.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> stands for the
Hilbert space of all real-valued functions on <Math mode="inline" tex="\partial{K}" text="partial-differential@(K)" xml:id="S2.p3.m28">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> that
are measurable and square-integrable with respect to the
<Math mode="inline" tex="(d-1)" text="d - 1" xml:id="S2.p3.m29">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m29.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.p3.m29.1">
                  <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-dimensional Hausdorff measure.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p4">
      <p>Assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}" text="M" xml:id="S2.p4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a conforming simplicial mesh of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega" text="Omega" xml:id="S2.p4.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. More
precisely, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}" text="M" xml:id="S2.p4.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a finite sequence of <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S2.p4.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-simplices in <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbb{R}}^{d}}" text="R ^ d" xml:id="S2.p4.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> such
that</p>
      <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_gather" xml:id="A0.EGx1">
        <equation labels="LABEL:A:conforming_mesh" xml:id="S2.E2">
          <tags>
            <tag>(2.2)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">2.2</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="\displaystyle\overline{\Omega}=\bigcup_{{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}}{K}\qquad\text{and%&#10;}\qquad\forall{K},{K}^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{M}}\quad\operatorname{Vert}({K}\cap%&#10;{K}^{\prime})\subset\operatorname{Vert}{K}\cap\operatorname{Vert}{K}^{\prime}." text="formulae@(overline@(Omega) = list@((union _ (K element-of M))@(K), [and], for-all@(K)), formulae@(K ^ prime element-of M, Vert@(K intersection K ^ prime) subset-of Vert@(K) intersection Vert@(K ^ prime)))" xml:id="S2.E2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.E2.m1.3"/>
                <XMWrap>

        </equation>
      </equationgroup>
      <p>In §<ref labelref="LABEL:S:ConformityImpact"/> below we make an additional
assumption on the mesh <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}" text="M" xml:id="S2.p4.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The second condition in
(<ref labelref="LABEL:A:conforming_mesh"/>) has two implications. First, it ensures
that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}" text="M" xml:id="S2.p4.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a non-overlapping covering in that there holds</p>
      <equation xml:id="S2.Ex1">
        <Math mode="display" tex="{\left|{\Omega}\right|}=\sum_{{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}}{\left|{K}\right|}" text="absolute-value@(Omega) = (sum _ (K element-of M))@(absolute-value@(K))" xml:id="S2.Ex1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Ex1.m1.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex1.m1.1">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Ex1.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex1.m1.2">K</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>for the Lebesgue measure <Math mode="inline" tex="{\left|{\cdot}\right|}" xml:id="S2.p4.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
            <XMTok name="cdot" role="MULOP">⋅</XMTok>
            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbb{R}}^{d}}" text="R ^ d" xml:id="S2.p4.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Second, it entails
that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}" text="M" xml:id="S2.p4.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is conforming or face-to-face, i.e. for any two
‘elements’ <Math mode="inline" tex="{K},{K}^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{M}}" text="list@(K, K ^ prime) element-of M" xml:id="S2.p4.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                  <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m11.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p4.m11.1">K</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p4.m11.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the intersection <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}\cap{K}^{\prime}" text="K intersection K ^ prime" xml:id="S2.p4.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a
<Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S2.p4.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-face of both <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S2.p4.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-simplices <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}" text="K" xml:id="S2.p4.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}^{\prime}" text="K ^ prime" xml:id="S2.p4.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

              <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for some
<Math mode="inline" tex="k\in\{0,\dots,d\}" text="k element-of set@(0, dots, d)" xml:id="S2.p4.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>

    <para xml:id="S2.p5">
      <p>The existence of a conforming simplicial mesh implies that <Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega" text="Omega" xml:id="S2.p5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is
bounded and some regularity for its boundary <Math mode="inline" tex="\partial\Omega" text="partial-differential@(Omega)" xml:id="S2.p5.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. In
particular, cusps are outruled but domains like the slit domain
<Math mode="inline" tex="\{x=(x_{1},x_{2})\in{\mathbb{R}}^{2}\mid\max\{|x_{1}|,|x_{2}|\}&lt;1,x_{2}\neq 0%&#10;\text{ or&#10;}x_{1}&lt;0\}" text="conditional-set@(x = open-interval@(x _ 1, x _ 2) element-of R ^ 2, formulae@(maximum@(absolute-value@(x _ 1), absolute-value@(x _ 2)) less 1, x _ 2 not-equals 0 * [ or&#10;] * x _ 1 less 0))" xml:id="S2.p5.m3">

            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are allowed. For the latter example, the usual definition
<!--  %**** String Line 250 **** -->of the trace operator <Math mode="inline" tex="{H^{{1}}}(\Omega)\to{L^{{2}}}(\partial\Omega)" text="H ^ 1 * Omega to L ^ 2 * partial-differential@(Omega)" xml:id="S2.p5.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p5.m4.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p5.m4.1">Ω</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p5.m4.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p5.m4.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> does
not apply as the boundary is not locally a graph of a function.
Nevertheless, exploiting (<ref labelref="LABEL:TraceOp"/>), we can define that a
function <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in{H^{{1}}}(\Omega)" text="v element-of H ^ 1 * Omega" xml:id="S2.p5.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p5.m5.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p5.m5.1">Ω</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> equals a function <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in{L^{2}}(\partial\Omega)" text="g element-of L ^ 2 * partial-differential@(Omega)" xml:id="S2.p5.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p5.m6.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p5.m6.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on
the boundary by</p>
      <equation xml:id="S2.Ex2">

      <p>The first property in the definition of <Math mode="inline" tex="{S}^{{\ell},0}_{0}({\mathcal{M}})" text="(S ^ (list@(ell, 0))) _ 0 * M" xml:id="S2.p6.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p6.m2.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p6.m2.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p6.m2.1">ℓ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p6.m2.2">0</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p6.m2.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p6.m2.3">M</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
determines the basic nature of the approximants: their piecewise
structure and that each one can be identified with a finite number of
parameters. The role of the other two properties, which constrain this basic
nature, is clarified by the following proposition in terms of the space</p>
      <equation xml:id="S2.Ex4">
        <Math mode="display" tex="{S}^{{\ell},{-1}}({\mathcal{M}}){:=}\{V:\overline{\Omega}\to{\mathbb{R}}\mid%&#10;\forall{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}\ V_{|{K}}\in{\mathcal{P}_{{\ell}}({{K}})}\}" text="S ^ (list@(ell, - 1)) * M assign conditional-set@(V, overline@(Omega) to conditional@(R, for-all@(K)) element-of M * V _ [|K] element-of P _ ell * K)" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.1">ℓ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.2">
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>

                    <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>of all functions that are piecewise polynomial over <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}" text="M" xml:id="S2.p6.m3">
          <XMath>

space</p>

      <p>of all functions that are in addition continuous.

    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_prop" inlist="thm theorem:prop" labels="LABEL:P:conforming" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Proposition 2.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Proposition 2.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Proposition 2.1</text></tag> (Characterization of <Math mode="inline" tex="H^{1}" text="H ^ 1" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>- and <Math mode="inline" tex="H^{1}_{0}" text="(H ^ 1) _ 0" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-conformity).</title>
      <para xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">A piecewise polynomial function <Math mode="inline" tex="V\in{S}^{{\ell},{-1}}({\mathcal{M}})" text="V element-of S ^ (list@(ell, - 1)) * M" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m1.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m1.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m1.1">ℓ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m1.2">
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m1.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m1.3">M</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is
in <Math mode="inline" tex="{H^{{1}}}(\Omega)" text="H ^ 1 * Omega" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m2.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m2.1">Ω</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> if and only if it is continuous in
<Math mode="inline" tex="\overline{\Omega}" text="overline@(Omega)" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Moreover, a continuous piecewise polynomial
function <Math mode="inline" tex="V\in{S}^{{\ell},0}({\mathcal{M}})" text="V element-of S ^ (list@(ell, 0)) * M" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m4.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m4.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m4.1">ℓ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m4.2">0</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m4.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m4.3">M</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is in <Math mode="inline" tex="{H^{{1}}}_{0}(\Omega)" text="(H ^ 1) _ 0 * Omega" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m5.1">Ω</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
if and only if <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{|\partial\Omega}=0" text="V _ [|∂Ω] = 0" xml:id="S2.Thmprop1.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMArg rule="Subscript">
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                    </XMArg>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S2.p7">
        <p>The first equivalence is a consequence of
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Braess:01" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Chapter II, Theorem 5.1]</cite>, while then the second one
immediately follows from definition (<ref labelref="LABEL:D:H10"/>).
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <para xml:id="S2.p8">
      <p>Hence the requirements <Math mode="inline" tex="V\in C^{0}(\overline{\Omega})" text="V element-of C ^ 0 * overline@(Omega)" xml:id="S2.p8.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p8.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p8.m1.1">
                      <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{|\partial\Omega}=0" text="V _ [|∂Ω] = 0" xml:id="S2.p8.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMArg rule="Subscript">
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                </XMArg>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
are sufficient and necessary for conformity of the approximants. Clearly, the
first requirement <Math mode="inline" tex="V\in C^{0}(\overline{\Omega})" text="V element-of C ^ 0 * overline@(Omega)" xml:id="S2.p8.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p8.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p8.m3.1">
                      <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is independent from the
considered boundary condition <Math mode="inline" tex="v_{|\partial\Omega}" text="v _ [|∂Ω]" xml:id="S2.p8.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
              <XMArg rule="Subscript">
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
              </XMArg>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>; see also Corollaries
<ref labelref="LABEL:C:Dirichlet"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:C:Neumann"/> below.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p9">
      <p>Next, we recall the Lagrange basis of <Math mode="inline" tex="{S}^{{\ell},0}({\mathcal{M}})" text="S ^ (list@(ell, 0)) * M" xml:id="S2.p9.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p9.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p9.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p9.m1.1">ℓ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

      <equation xml:id="S2.Ex8">
        <Math mode="display" tex="{L_{{\ell}}}({\mathcal{M}}){:=}\bigcup_{{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}}{L_{{\ell}}}({K});" text="L _ ell * M assign (union _ (K element-of M))@(L _ ell * K)" xml:id="S2.Ex8.m1">

                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex8.m1.2"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex8.m1.2">K</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>notice that a node <Math mode="inline" tex="z\in{L_{{\ell}}}({\mathcal{M}})" text="z element-of L _ ell * M" xml:id="S2.p9.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> may be shared by
several elements <Math mode="inline" tex="K\in{\mathcal{M}}" text="K element-of M" xml:id="S2.p9.m15">
          <XMath>

            </XMApp>

        </Math>.</p>
    </para>

        </Math>. Each
basis function <Math mode="inline" tex="{\Phi}_{z}" text="Phi _ z" xml:id="S2.p10.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
