                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.E5.m1.6.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="true">[</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S3.E5.m1.6.2">
                              <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                                <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMDual>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                                      <XMRef idref="S3.E5.m1.3"/>
                                      <XMRef idref="S3.E5.m1.4"/>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.E5.m1.3">v</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.E5.m1.4">K</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="true">]</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok mathstyle="script" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>is valid; if there is no such constant <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="S3.SS1.p5.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, set <Math mode="inline" tex="{\delta}({\mathcal{M}})=\infty" text="delta * M = infinity" xml:id="S3.SS1.p5.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p5.m4.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS1.p5.m4.1">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. We
refer to <Math mode="inline" tex="{\delta}({\mathcal{M}})" text="delta * M" xml:id="S3.SS1.p5.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p5.m5.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS1.p5.m5.1">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> as the decoupling coefficient of <Math mode="inline" tex="{S}({\mathcal{M}})" text="S * M" xml:id="S3.SS1.p5.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p5.m6.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS1.p5.m6.1">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
If the decoupling coefficient is big, or even <Math mode="inline" tex="\infty" text="infinity" xml:id="S3.SS1.p5.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, requiring continuity
entails that the local approximation potential is not well exploited, at least
for some target functions. If it is moderate, or even 1, dispensing with
continuity does not improve the approximation quality in a substantial manner.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS1.p6">
        <p>It is instructive to consider, for a moment, (<ref labelref="LABEL:global&lt;=Clocal"/>) with
<Math mode="inline" tex="X={L^{2}}(\Omega)" text="X = L ^ 2 * Omega" xml:id="S3.SS1.p6.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p6.m1.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS1.p6.m1.1">Ω</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and to replace the <Math mode="inline" tex="{H^{1}}" text="H ^ 1" xml:id="S3.SS1.p6.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-seminorm by the <Math mode="inline" tex="{L^{{2}}}" text="L ^ 2" xml:id="S3.SS1.p6.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-norm.
Then a function from
<Math mode="inline" tex="{S}^{{\ell},-1}({\mathcal{M}})\setminus{S}^{{\ell},0}({\mathcal{M}})" text="S ^ (list@(ell, - 1)) * M set-minus S ^ (list@(ell, 0)) * M" xml:id="S3.SS1.p6.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p6.m4.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p6.m4.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS1.p6.m4.1">ℓ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS1.p6.m4.2">
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p6.m4.5"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS1.p6.m4.5">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p6.m4.3"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p6.m4.4"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS1.p6.m4.3">ℓ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.SS1.p6.m4.4">0</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p6.m4.6"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS1.p6.m4.6">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is an
admissible target function and we immediately obtain that there holds
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\delta}({\mathcal{M}})=\infty" text="delta * M = infinity" xml:id="S3.SS1.p6.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p6.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS1.p6.m5.1">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in this case.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS1.p7">
        <p>The following lemma introduces the key property of the <Math mode="inline" tex="{H^{1}}" text="H ^ 1" xml:id="S3.SS1.p7.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-seminorm
that ensures a finite decoupling coefficient.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_lem" inlist="thm theorem:lem" labels="LABEL:L:TraceAndError" xml:id="S3.Thmlem1">
        <tags>
          <tag>Lemma 3.1</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">3.1</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Lemma 3.1</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Lemma 3.1</text></tag> (Trace and error norm).</title>

                <XMath>

              </Math>, there holds</text></p>
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex5">

          <p><text font="italic">where <Math mode="inline" tex="{{C_{\text{Tr}}}}{:=}\sqrt{C_{P}(C_{P}+2/d)}" text="C _ [Tr] assign square-root@(C _ P * (C _ P + 2 / d))" xml:id="S3.Thmlem1.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                      <XMText><text fontsize="70%">Tr</text></XMText>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="square-root"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.Thmlem1.p1.m7.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmlem1.p1.m7.1">
                              <XMTok font="upright" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok font="upright" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="C_{P}" text="C _ P" xml:id="S3.Thmlem1.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is the optimal Poincaré
constant for <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S3.Thmlem1.p1.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-simplices. The quotient between the parathensis is bounded in
terms of the shape coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="h_{K}/\rho_{K}" text="h _ K / rho _ K" xml:id="S3.Thmlem1.p1.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}" text="K" xml:id="S3.Thmlem1.p1.m11">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS1.p8">
        <p>The classical result of L. E. Payne and H. F. Weinberger
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Payne.Weinberger:60" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, see also M. Bebendorf <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Bebendorf:03" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>,
ensures <Math mode="inline" tex="C_{P}\leq 1/\pi" text="C _ P less= 1 / pi" xml:id="S3.SS1.p8.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. In the case <Math mode="inline" tex="d=2" text="d = 2" xml:id="S3.SS1.p8.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, R. S. Laugesen and B. A. Siudeja <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Laugesen.Siudeja:10" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> show <Math mode="inline" tex="C_{P}=1/{j_{1,1}}" text="C _ P = 1 / j _ (list@(1, 1))" xml:id="S3.SS1.p8.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p8.m3.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p8.m3.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.SS1.p8.m3.1">1</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.SS1.p8.m3.2">1</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> where
<Math mode="inline" tex="j_{1,1}\approx 3.8317" text="j _ (list@(1, 1)) approximately-equals 3.8317" xml:id="S3.SS1.p8.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="approx" role="RELOP">≈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p8.m4.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p8.m4.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.SS1.p8.m4.1">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.SS1.p8.m4.2">1</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="3.8317" role="NUMBER">3.8317</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> denotes the first positive root of the Bessel function
<Math mode="inline" tex="J_{1}" text="J _ 1" xml:id="S3.SS1.p8.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <proof>
        <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
        <para xml:id="S3.SS1.p9">
          <p>Corollary 4.5 and Remark 4.6 of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Veeser.Verfuerth:09" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> imply the
<!--  %**** String Line 650 **** -->trace inequality</p>
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex6">
            <Math mode="display" tex="\frac{1}{{\left|{F}\right|}}{{\left\|{{w}}\right\|_{{0,2;{F}}}}}^{2}\leq\frac{%&#10;1}{{\left|{K}\right|}}{{\left\|{{w}}\right\|_{{0,2;{K}}}}}^{2}+\frac{2h_{K}}{d%&#10;{\left|{K}\right|}}{{\left\|{{w}}\right\|_{{0,2;{K}}}}}{{\left\|{{{\nabla}w}}%&#10;\right\|_{{0,2;{K}}}}}." text="(1 / absolute-value@(F)) * ((norm@(w)) _ (list@(0, 2, F))) ^ 2 less= (1 / absolute-value@(K)) * ((norm@(w)) _ (list@(0, 2, K))) ^ 2 + ((2 * h _ K) / (d * absolute-value@(K))) * (norm@(w)) _ (list@(0, 2, K)) * (norm@(nabla@(w))) _ (list@(0, 2, K))" xml:id="S3.Ex6.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.Ex6.m1.19"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex6.m1.19">
                      <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                        <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>

                          <XMApp>

              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>We thus obtain the claimed inequality for <Math mode="inline" tex="w" text="w" xml:id="S3.SS1.p9.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> by inserting the Poincaré
inequality</p>
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex7">
            <Math mode="display" tex="{{\left\|{{w}}\right\|_{{0,2;{K}}}}}\leq C_{P}h_{K}{{\left\|{{{\nabla}w}}%&#10;\right\|_{{0,2;{K}}}}}," text="(norm@(w)) _ (list@(0, 2, K)) less= C _ P * h _ K * (norm@(nabla@(w))) _ (list@(0, 2, K))" xml:id="S3.Ex7.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.Ex7.m1.8"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex7.m1.8">
                      <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.Ex7.m1.7"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex7.m1.7">w</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.Ex7.m1.1"/>

                            <XMRef idref="S3.Ex7.m1.3"/>
                          </XMApp>

                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.Ex7.m1.1">0</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.Ex7.m1.2">2</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex7.m1.3">K</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S3.Ex7.m1.8.1"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>

                                <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S3.Ex7.m1.4"/>

                              <XMRef idref="S3.Ex7.m1.6"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.Ex7.m1.4">0</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.Ex7.m1.5">2</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>

                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>which applies thanks to <Math mode="inline" tex="\int_{K}w=0" text="(integral _ K)@(w) = 0" xml:id="S3.SS1.p9.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S3.SS1.p10">
          <p>In order to bound the quotient between the parathensis, observe that
Cavallieri’s principle yields <Math mode="inline" tex="{\left|{K}\right|}=(h^{\perp}_{F}{\left|{F}\right|})/d" text="absolute-value@(K) = ((h ^ perpendicular-to) _ F * absolute-value@(F)) / d" xml:id="S3.SS1.p10.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p10.m1.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS1.p10.m1.1">K</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p10.m1.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS1.p10.m1.3">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="perpendicular-to" name="perp" role="RELOP">⟂</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p10.m1.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS1.p10.m1.2">F</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>,
where <Math mode="inline" tex="h^{\perp}_{F}" text="(h ^ perpendicular-to) _ F" xml:id="S3.SS1.p10.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="perpendicular-to" name="perp" role="RELOP">⟂</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> denotes the height of <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}" text="K" xml:id="S3.SS1.p10.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> over <Math mode="inline" tex="{F}" text="F" xml:id="S3.SS1.p10.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Hence we
obtain</p>
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex8">
            <Math mode="display" tex="\frac{h_{K}{\left|{F}\right|}}{{\left|{K}\right|}}=d\frac{h_{K}}{h^{\perp}_{F}%&#10;}\leq d\frac{h_{K}}{\rho_{K}}" text="(h _ K * absolute-value@(F)) / absolute-value@(K) = d * (h _ K / (h ^ perpendicular-to) _ F) less= d * (h _ K / rho _ K)" xml:id="S3.Ex8.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.Ex8.m1.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex8.m1.1">F</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.Ex8.m1.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex8.m1.2">K</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
<!--  %**** String Line 675 **** -->                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="perpendicular-to" name="perp" role="RELOP">⟂</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>with the help of the inequality <Math mode="inline" tex="\rho_{K}\leq h^{\perp}_{F}" text="rho _ K less= (h ^ perpendicular-to) _ F" xml:id="S3.SS1.p10.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="perpendicular-to" name="perp" role="RELOP">⟂</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
∎</p>
        </para>
      </proof>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS1.p11">
        <p>The significance of Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:L:TraceAndError"/> lies in the following
observations.
If the intersection <Math mode="inline" tex="{F}" text="F" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of two elements <Math mode="inline" tex="K_{1},K_{2}\in{\mathcal{M}}" text="list@(K _ 1, K _ 2) element-of M" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p11.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p11.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m2.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a common
<Math mode="inline" tex="(d-1)" text="d - 1" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p11.m3.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m3.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-face, then the condition <Math mode="inline" tex="V\in C^{0}(\overline{\Omega})" text="V element-of C ^ 0 * overline@(Omega)" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS1.p11.m4.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m4.1">
                        <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> requires that the
traces <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{|\partial{K}_{1}}" text="V _ [|∂K1]" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMArg rule="Subscript">
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMArg>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{|\partial{K}_{2}}" text="V _ [|∂K2]" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMArg rule="Subscript">
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMArg>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> coincide on <Math mode="inline" tex="{F}" text="F" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
The local best approximation <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{{K}_{1}}" text="P _ K _ 1" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{{K}_{2}}" text="P _ K _ 2" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are close to this
property in that, thanks to Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:L:TraceAndError"/>, their properly
measured difference is bounded in terms of the local best errors:</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx3">
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex9">

              <MathBranch>
                <td align="right"><Math mode="inline" tex="\displaystyle h_{F}^{-\frac{1}{2}}{{\left\|{{P_{{K}_{1}}-P_{{K}_{2}}}}\right\|%&#10;_{{0,2;{F}}}}}" text="(h _ F) ^ (- 1 / 2) * (norm@(P _ K _ 1 - P _ K _ 2)) _ (list@(0, 2, F))" xml:id="S3.Ex9.m1">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>

        <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="h_{F}{:=}\operatorname{diam}{F}" text="h _ F assign diam@(F)" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">diam</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> depends on <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and on the shape
<!--  %**** String Line 700 **** -->coefficients of <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}_{1}" text="K _ 1" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}_{2}" text="K _ 2" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Consequently, the trace <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{|{F}}" text="V _ [|F]" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMArg rule="Subscript">
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                </XMArg>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
can be defined by <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{K_{1}}" text="P _ K _ 1" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{K_{2}}" text="P _ K _ 2" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> or a mixture of both without
substantially downgrading the approximation potential of the shape functions of
the two elements <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}_{1}" text="K _ 1" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}_{2}" text="K _ 2" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The same remark applies to near best
approximations in place of <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{K_{1}}" text="P _ K _ 1" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{K_{2}}" text="P _ K _ 2" xml:id="S3.SS1.p11.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS1.p12">
        <p>Similary, Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:L:TraceAndError"/> implies that, thanks to
<Math mode="inline" tex="v_{|\partial\Omega}=0" text="v _ [|∂Ω] = 0" xml:id="S3.SS1.p12.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                  <XMArg rule="Subscript">
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                  </XMArg>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, properly measured traces on <Math mode="inline" tex="\partial\Omega" text="partial-differential@(Omega)" xml:id="S3.SS1.p12.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of local
best approximations are bounded again in terms of local best errors or, in
other words, almost vanish. Consequently, enforcing vanishing boundary values
will not downgrade the approximation quality.</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" xml:id="S3.SS2">
      <tags>
        <tag>3.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">3.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§3.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">3.2</tag>Interpolation</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">3.2</tag>Interpolation</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS2.p1">
        <p>In order to show that the decoupling coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="{\delta}({\mathcal{M}})" text="delta * M" xml:id="S3.SS2.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                  <XMRef idref="S3.SS2.p1.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS2.p1.m1.1">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is finite,
we define</p>
        <equation xml:id="S3.Ex11">

      <para xml:id="S3.SS2.p2">

            </Math>, for the nodal
values. For this purpose, it is convenient to introduce the following notion.
<!--  %**** String Line 750 **** -->A node <Math mode="inline" tex="z\in{L_{{\ell}}}({\mathcal{M}})" text="z element-of L _ ell * M" xml:id="S3.E8.m5">
              <XMath>

                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.E8.m5.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is called unconstrained in
<Math mode="inline" tex="{S}({\mathcal{M}})" text="S * M" xml:id="S3.E8.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                  <XMDual>

                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.E8.m6.1">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>

              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">supp</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is contained in one element
of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}" text="M" xml:id="S3.E8.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and there holds <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{span}{\Phi}_{z}\subset{S}({\mathcal{M}})" text="span@(Phi _ z) subset-of S * M" xml:id="S3.E8.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">span</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.E8.m9.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.E8.m9.1">M</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Extending
functions on elements by zero, this is equivalent to requiring that there
holds <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{span}{\Phi}_{z}{}_{|{K}}\subset{S}({\mathcal{M}})" xml:id="S3.E8.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">span</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="pre2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                  <XMArg rule="Subscript">
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  </XMArg>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for any element
<Math mode="inline" tex="{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}" text="K element-of M" xml:id="S3.E8.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Unotherwise <Math mode="inline" tex="z" text="z" xml:id="S3.E8.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is called constrained and we write
<Math mode="inline" tex="z\in{\mathcal{C}}" text="z element-of C" xml:id="S3.E8.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</p>
          <p>Fix an arbitrary node <Math mode="inline" tex="z\in{L_{{\ell}}}({\mathcal{M}})" text="z element-of L _ ell * M" xml:id="S3.E8.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.E8.m14.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.E8.m14.1">M</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. If <Math mode="inline" tex="z\not\in{\mathcal{C}}" text="z not-element-of C" xml:id="S3.E8.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="not-element-of" name="not-in" role="RELOP">∉</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, then
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\Pi}_{z}v" text="Pi _ z * v" xml:id="S3.E8.m16">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> affects only the local error <Math mode="inline" tex="{\left|{v-{\Pi}v}\right|_{K}}" text="(absolute-value@(v - Pi * v)) _ K" xml:id="S3.E8.m17">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.E8.m17.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.E8.m17.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> on that
element. In this case, set</p>
          <equation labels="LABEL:DefIp:unconstrained" xml:id="S3.E8.1">
            <tags>
              <tag>(3.8a)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">3.8a</tag>
            </tags>
            <Math mode="display" tex="{\Pi}_{z}v{:=}P_{K}(z)," text="Pi _ z * v assign P _ K * z" xml:id="S3.E8.1.m1">

                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="P_{K}" text="P _ K" xml:id="S3.E8.m18">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is given by (<ref labelref="LABEL:Pelm"/>).</p>
          <p>Whereas, if <Math mode="inline" tex="z\in{\mathcal{C}}" text="z element-of C" xml:id="S3.E8.m19">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, then <Math mode="inline" tex="{\Pi}_{z}v" text="Pi _ z * v" xml:id="S3.E8.m20">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> has to deviate from
(<ref labelref="LABEL:DefIp:unconstrained"/>) for at least one other element or has to assume a
prescribed value. In order to meet both issues, we employ the Scott-Zhang
functionals (<ref labelref="LABEL:ScottZhangFct"/>). To this end, fix some face
<Math mode="inline" tex="{F}_{z}\in{\mathcal{F}_{d-1}}({\mathcal{M}})" text="F _ z element-of F _ (d - 1) * M" xml:id="S3.E8.m21">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.E8.m21.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.E8.m21.1">M</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> containing <Math mode="inline" tex="z" text="z" xml:id="S3.E8.m22">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>; this choice may be subject to
further conditions for certain examples of <Math mode="inline" tex="{S}({\mathcal{M}})" text="S * M" xml:id="S3.E8.m23">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.E8.m23.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.E8.m23.1">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. We then set</p>
          <equation labels="LABEL:DefIp:constrained" xml:id="S3.E8.2">
            <tags>
              <tag>(3.8b)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">3.8b</tag>
            </tags>
            <Math mode="display" tex="{\Pi}_{z}v{:=}{N}_{z;F_{z}}(v)." text="Pi _ z * v assign N _ (list@(z, F _ z)) * v" xml:id="S3.E8.2.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.E8.2.m1.4"/>

                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                            </XMApp>

                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>We illustrate this definition in the setting of the introduction §<ref labelref="LABEL:S:Intro"/>
where <Math mode="inline" tex="X={H^{1}}_{0}(\Omega)" text="X = (H ^ 1) _ 0 * Omega" xml:id="S3.E8.m24">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="{S}({\mathcal{M}})={S}^{{\ell},0}_{0}({\mathcal{M}})" text="S * M = (S ^ (list@(ell, 0))) _ 0 * M" xml:id="S3.E8.m25">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                      <XMWrap>

                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                          </XMApp>

                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.E8.m25.2">0</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>

                    </XMApp>

                      <XMWrap>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
Here there holds</p>
          <equation xml:id="S3.E8.x13">
            <Math mode="display" tex="{\mathcal{C}}={L_{{\ell}}}({\mathcal{M}})\cap{\Sigma}\quad\text{with}\quad{%&#10;\Sigma}{:=}\bigcup_{{F}\in{\mathcal{F}_{d-1}}({\mathcal{M}})}{F}" text="formulae@(C = list@(L _ ell * M intersection Sigma, [with]), Sigma assign (union _ (F element-of F _ (d - 1) * M))@(F))" xml:id="S3.E8.x13.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>

                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S3.E8.x13.m1.2"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.E8.x13.m1.2">M</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="quad" role="PUNCT"> </XMTok>
                          <XMText xml:id="S3.E8.x13.m1.3">with</XMText>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="quad" role="PUNCT"> </XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.E8.x13.m1.5">
                      <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                          <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="display" meaning="union" name="bigcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">⋃</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>

                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S3.E8.x13.m1.1"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                          </XMApp>

                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>and, if <Math mode="inline" tex="z\in{\mathcal{C}}" text="z element-of C" xml:id="S3.E8.m26">

            </Math> lies on the
boundary. This readily ensures (<ref labelref="LABEL:Ip;BdryVals"/>). In Remark <ref labelref="LABEL:R:Ip"/>
