                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="true">]</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="script" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p><text font="italic">where <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="S3.Thmcor2.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is the constant from Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:LDcplng"/>. Consequently,
the decoupling coefficient of <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{S}({\mathcal{M}})" text="tilde@(S) * M" xml:id="S3.Thmcor2.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.Thmcor2.p1.m3.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmcor2.p1.m3.1">M</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is bounded
in terms of <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S3.Thmcor2.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\ell}" text="ell" xml:id="S3.Thmcor2.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{\mathcal{M}}" text="sigma _ M" xml:id="S3.Thmcor2.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <proof>
        <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
        <para xml:id="S3.SS4.p8">
          <p>Identifying
<Math mode="inline" tex="{H^{1}}(\Omega)/{\mathbb{R}}" text="(H ^ 1 * Omega) / R" xml:id="S3.SS4.p8.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS4.p8.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS4.p8.m1.1">Ω</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\{v\in{H^{1}}(\Omega)\mid\int_{\Omega}v=0\}" text="conditional-set@(v element-of H ^ 1 * Omega, (integral _ Omega)@(v) = 0)" xml:id="S3.SS4.p8.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="conditional-set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS4.p8.m2.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS4.p8.m2.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS4.p8.m2.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.SS4.p8.m2.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS4.p8.m2.1">Ω</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="mid" role="VERTBAR">∣</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS4.p8.m2.3">
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>,
the implication (<ref labelref="LABEL:Ip;BdryVals"/>) holds with <Math mode="inline" tex="X=\tilde{X}" text="X = tilde@(X)" xml:id="S3.SS4.p8.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and Theorem
(<ref labelref="LABEL:T:elm-dec"/>) again yields the claim.
∎</p>
        </para>
      </proof>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS4.p9">
        <p>Similarly, one can consider Robin boundary conditions or mixed ones and obtain
corresponding statements.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_rem" inlist="thm theorem:rem" labels="LABEL:R:Ip" xml:id="S3.Thmrem1">
        <tags>
          <tag>Remark 3.1</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">3.1</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 3.1</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 3.1</text></tag> (Construction of interpolation operator).</title>
        <para xml:id="S3.Thmrem1.p1">
          <p>The definition of the nodal values <Math mode="inline" tex="{\Pi}_{z}v" text="Pi _ z * v" xml:id="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for constrained nodes
<Math mode="inline" tex="z\in{L_{{\ell}}}({\mathcal{M}})\cap{\mathcal{C}}" text="z element-of L _ ell * M intersection C" xml:id="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m2.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m2.1">M</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is the critical part. For constrained
<!--  %**** String Line 1250 **** -->nodes on the boundary, we follow the approach of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Scott.Zhang:90" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.
The role of (<ref labelref="LABEL:nbnval"/>) in proving Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:elm-dec"/> reveals that this
is a near best choice with respect to the involved local errors and can be
adopted also for the other constrained nodes. Inequality (<ref labelref="LABEL:nbnval"/>) shows
also that the particular admissible choice of <Math mode="inline" tex="{F}_{z}" text="F _ z" xml:id="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> does not matter.
Moreover, its proof reveals that, for interior constrained nodes, also
<Math mode="inline" tex="P_{K}(z)" text="P _ K * z" xml:id="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m4.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m4.1">z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> where the element <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}" text="K" xml:id="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> contains <Math mode="inline" tex="z" text="z" xml:id="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, or some average of these
values may be used. Interpolation operators of this type may be viewed as
a composition of taking a best approximation in <Math mode="inline" tex="S^{\ell,-1}({\mathcal{M}})" text="S ^ (list@(ell, - 1)) * M" xml:id="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m7.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m7.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m7.1">ℓ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m7.2">
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m7.3"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmrem1.p1.m7.3">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and
a so-called enriching operator. The latter have been used to connect
non-conforming finite element methods to conforming ones in various contexts;
see, e.g., S. Brenner <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Brenner:96,Brenner:99" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, O. S. Karakashian and
F. Pascal <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Karakashian.Pascal:03" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, T. Gudi <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Gudi:10" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and A. Bonito
and R. H. Nochetto <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Bonito.Nochetto:10" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.</p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:S:grd-conformity" xml:id="S3.SS5">
      <tags>
        <tag>3.5</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">3.5</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§3.5</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">3.5</tag>Local gradient conformity</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">3.5</tag>Local gradient conformity</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS5.p1">
        <p>The local best errors <Math mode="inline" tex="e(v,{K})" text="e * open-interval@(v, K)" xml:id="S3.SS5.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p1.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p1.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS5.p1.m1.1">v</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS5.p1.m1.2">K</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}" text="K element-of M" xml:id="S3.SS5.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, are related to approximation
problems of the following type. Approximate a vector function, which is the
gradient of a scalar function, with gradients of polynomial functions. The
components of the approximants are coupled whenever <Math mode="inline" tex="{\ell}\geq 2" text="ell &gt;= 2" xml:id="S3.SS5.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>: indeed, the
value of higher order partial derivatives then does not depend on their order of
application. Hence the following question arises: Does this coupling lead to
some downgrading with respect to approximants, the components of which are
<!--  %**** String Line 1275 **** -->independent polynomial functions?</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS5.p2">
        <p>A similar question arises for <Math mode="inline" tex="E(v,{\mathcal{M}})" text="E * open-interval@(v, M)" xml:id="S3.SS5.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p2.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p2.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS5.p2.m1.1">v</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS5.p2.m1.2">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. However, in view of Theorem
<ref labelref="LABEL:T:elm-dec"/>, it suffices for both questions to compare the local best
errors <Math mode="inline" tex="e(v,{K})" text="e * open-interval@(v, K)" xml:id="S3.SS5.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p2.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p2.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS5.p2.m2.1">v</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS5.p2.m2.2">K</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}" text="K element-of M" xml:id="S3.SS5.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, with the following ones:</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx5">
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex41">
            <MathFork>

                                    <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid9"/>

                                      </XMApp>

        <p>for <Math mode="inline" tex="f\in{L^{2}}(\Omega)^{d}" text="f element-of L ^ 2 * Omega ^ d" xml:id="S3.SS5.p2.m4">
            <XMath>

          </Math>. Also here the inequality
<!--  %**** String Line 1300 **** --></p>
        <equation xml:id="S3.Ex43">
          <Math mode="display" tex="{\underline{e}}(v,{K})\leq e(v,{K})" text="underline@(e) * open-interval@(v, K) less= e * open-interval@(v, K)" xml:id="S3.Ex43.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>

                  <XMApp>

                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex43.m1.2">K</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.Ex43.m1.3"/>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex43.m1.3">v</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex43.m1.4">K</XMTok>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>is straight-forward, while the opposite one is more involved and its proof
relies on the construction of a suitable (quasi-)interpolant. We shall use the
averaged Taylor polynomial of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Dupont.Scott:80" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> by T. Dupont and
L. R. Scott, which is a variant of the one of S. L. Sobolev. In order to
avoid a dependence on the element shape, we follow an idea of S. Dekel and
D. Leviatan in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Dekel.Leviatan:04" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and average in a reference
configuration.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:T:pder-dec" xml:id="S3.Thmthm3">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 3.3</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">3.3</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 3.3</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 3.3</text></tag> (Decoupling of partial derivatives).</title>
        <para xml:id="S3.Thmthm3.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">There is a constant <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="S3.Thmthm3.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> depending only on <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S3.Thmthm3.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\ell}\in{\mathbb{N}}" text="ell element-of N" xml:id="S3.Thmthm3.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that, for any
element <Math mode="inline" tex="{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}" text="K element-of M" xml:id="S3.Thmthm3.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and any function <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in{H^{1}}({K})" text="v element-of H ^ 1 * K" xml:id="S3.Thmthm3.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>

                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                          <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, there holds</text></p>
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex44">
            <Math mode="display" tex="e(v,{K})\leq C{\underline{e}}(v,{K})." text="e * open-interval@(v, K) less= C * underline@(e) * open-interval@(v, K)" xml:id="S3.Ex44.m1">

      </theorem>
      <proof>
        <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
        <para xml:id="S3.SS5.p3">
          <p>Given <Math mode="inline" tex="{\ell}\in{\mathbb{N}}_{0}" text="ell element-of N _ 0" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\ell}" text="I _ ell" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> the operator corresponding to the
averaged Taylor polynomial of order <Math mode="inline" tex="{\ell}+1" text="ell + 1" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> (and degree <Math mode="inline" tex="\leq{\ell})" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> over the
largest inscribed ball in <Math mode="inline" tex="{{{K}_{d}}}" text="K _ d" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Remarkably, the averaged Taylor
<!--  %**** String Line 1325 **** -->polynomial commutes with differentation in that <Math mode="inline" tex="\partial_{i}(I_{\ell}w)=I_{{\ell}-1}(\partial_{i}w)" text="(partial-differential _ i)@(I _ ell * w) = I _ (ell - 1) * (partial-differential _ i)@(w)" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p3.m6.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p3.m6.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m6.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m6.2">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p3.m6.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m6.3">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for all <Math mode="inline" tex="w\in{H^{1}}({{{K}_{d}}})" text="w element-of H ^ 1 * K _ d" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p3.m7.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m7.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and
<Math mode="inline" tex="i\in\{1,\dots,d\}" text="i element-of set@(1, dots, d)" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p3.m8.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p3.m8.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p3.m8.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m8.1">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m8.2">…</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m8.3">d</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>; see, e.g., <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Brenner.Scott:08" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, (4.1.17)]</cite>. Corollary
3.4 in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Dekel.Leviatan:04" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> generalizes this to</p>
          <equation labels="LABEL:Diff-avgTaylor" xml:id="S3.E15">
            <tags>

            <Math mode="display" tex="\partial_{i}\Big{(}\big{[}I_{\ell}(v\circ A)\big{]}\circ A^{-1}\Big{)}=\Big{(}%&#10;I_{{\ell}-1}\big{[}(\partial_{i}v)\circ A\big{]}\Big{)}\circ A^{-1}," text="(partial-differential _ i)@(delimited-[]@(I _ ell * (v compose A)) compose A ^ (- 1)) = (I _ (ell - 1) * delimited-[]@((partial-differential _ i)@(v) compose A)) compose A ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S3.E15.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>

          <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="A:{{{K}_{d}}}\to{K}" text="A colon K _ d to K" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>

                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is an affine bijection, <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in{H^{1}}({K})" text="v element-of H ^ 1 * K" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p3.m10.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>

            </Math> and
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\ell}\geq 1" text="ell &gt;= 1" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>

                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Moreover, <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\ell}" text="I _ ell" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

            </Math> is a <Math mode="inline" tex="{L^{2}}" text="L ^ 2" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-stable projection on
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{P}_{{\ell}}({{{{K}_{d}}}})}" text="P _ ell * K _ d" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p3.m14.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m14.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post7"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>: for any <Math mode="inline" tex="w\in{L^{2}}({{{K}_{d}}})" text="w element-of L ^ 2 * K _ d" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

              </XMath>
            </Math>, there hold</p>
          <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_gather" xml:id="A0.EGx6">
            <equation xml:id="S3.Ex45">
              <Math mode="display" tex="\displaystyle w\in{\mathcal{P}_{{\ell}}({{{{K}_{d}}}})}\implies I_{\ell}w=w," text="w element-of P _ ell * K _ d implies I _ ell * w = w" xml:id="S3.Ex45.m1">

                  <XMDual>

            <equation xml:id="S3.Ex46">
              <Math mode="display" tex="\displaystyle{\left\|{I_{\ell}w}\right\|_{{{K}_{d}}}}\leq C_{d,{\ell}}{\left\|%&#10;{w}\right\|_{{{K}_{d}}}}." text="(norm@(I _ ell * w)) _ K _ d less= C _ (list@(d, ell)) * (norm@(w)) _ K _ d" xml:id="S3.Ex46.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Ex46.m1.4"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex46.m1.4">
                        <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>

                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post10"/>
                          <XMDual>

                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post12"/>

                                </XMApp>

                          </XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post12"/>

                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S3.Ex46.m1.1"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S3.Ex46.m1.2"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex46.m1.1">d</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex46.m1.2">ℓ</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post10"/>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S3.Ex46.m1.3"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex46.m1.3">w</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post12"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>
            </equation>
          </equationgroup>
          <p>see, e.g., <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Brenner.Scott:08" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, (4.1.15), (4.2.8)]</cite>. Lemma 5 of J. Xu and
L. Zikatanov <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Xu.Zikatanov:03" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> therefore implies that <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\ell}" text="I _ ell" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m16">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is near
best with the constant <Math mode="inline" tex="C_{d,{\ell}}" text="C _ (list@(d, ell))" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m17">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p3.m17.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p3.m17.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m17.1">d</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS5.p3.m17.2">ℓ</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>:</p>

        <para xml:id="S3.SS5.p4">
          <p>Motivated by (<ref labelref="LABEL:Diff-avgTaylor"/>), we choose <Math mode="inline" tex="P=\big{[}I_{\ell}(v\circ A)\big{]}\circ A^{-1}\in{\mathcal{P}_{{\ell}}({{K}})}" text="P = delimited-[]@(I _ ell * (v compose A)) compose A ^ (- 1) element-of P _ ell * K" xml:id="S3.SS5.p4.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>

              <MathFork>

                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post10"/>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                                    <XMRef idref="S3.Ex51.m3.8"/>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex51.m3.8">
                                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp>
                                        <XMApp>
                                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post12"/>
                                          <XMTok meaning="partial-differential" name="partial" role="OPERATOR">∂</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                        </XMApp>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                                      </XMApp>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S3.Ex51.m3.4"/>

                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex51.m3.4">d</XMTok>

                                <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex51.m3.5">
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>

                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>

                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="underline" role="UNDERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S3.Ex51.m3.6"/>

                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex51.m3.6">v</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex51.m3.7">K</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>
                <MathBranch>
                  <td align="right"/>
                  <td align="left"><Math mode="inline" tex="\displaystyle\leq C_{d,{\ell}-1}^{2}\sum_{i=1}^{d}\inf_{R\in{\mathcal{P}_{{{%&#10;\ell}-1}}({{K}})}}{\left\|{\partial_{i}v-R}\right\|_{K}}^{2}=C_{d,{\ell}-1}^{2%&#10;}{\underline{e}}(v,{K})^{2}" text="absent less= (C _ (list@(d, ell - 1))) ^ 2 * ((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ d)@((infimum _ (R element-of P _ (ell - 1) * K))@(((norm@((partial-differential _ i)@(v) - R)) _ K) ^ 2)) = (C _ (list@(d, ell - 1))) ^ 2 * underline@(e) * (open-interval@(v, K)) ^ 2" xml:id="S3.Ex51.m2">
                      <XMath>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                          <XMTok meaning="absent"/>

                                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex51.m2.5">

                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok name="underline" role="UNDERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S3.Ex51.m2.6"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S3.Ex51.m2.7"/>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex51.m2.6">v</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex51.m2.7">K</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMath>
                    </Math></td>
                </MathBranch>
              </MathFork>
            </equation>
          </equationgroup>
          <p>Consequently, the claimed inequality holds with <Math mode="inline" tex="C=C_{d,{\ell}-1}" text="C = C _ (list@(d, ell - 1))" xml:id="S3.SS5.p4.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p4.m4.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.SS5.p4.m4.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.SS5.p4.m4.1">d</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.SS5.p4.m4.2">
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
∎</p>
        </para>
      </proof>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS5.p5">
        <p>The combination of Theorems <ref labelref="LABEL:T:elm-dec"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:T:pder-dec"/> yields the
following statement.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_cor" inlist="thm theorem:cor" labels="LABEL:C:elm-pd-dec" xml:id="S3.Thmcor3">
        <tags>
          <tag>Corollary 3.3</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">3.3</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Corollary 3.3</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Corollary 3.3</text></tag> (Decoupling of elements and partial derivatives).</title>
        <para xml:id="S3.Thmcor3.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">There is a constant <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="S3.Thmcor3.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that for any <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in X" text="v element-of X" xml:id="S3.Thmcor3.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> there holds</text></p>
          <equation xml:id="S3.Ex52">
            <Math mode="display" tex="E\big{(}v,{S}({\mathcal{M}})\big{)}\leq C\left[\sum_{{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}}{%&#10;\underline{e}}(v,{K})^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}," text="E * open-interval@(v, S * M) less= C * (delimited-[]@((sum _ (K element-of M))@(underline@(e) * (open-interval@(v, K)) ^ 2))) ^ (1 / 2)" xml:id="S3.Ex52.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.Ex52.m1.5"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex52.m1.5">
                      <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.Ex52.m1.2"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.Ex52.m1.5.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="120%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex52.m1.5.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S3.Ex52.m1.1"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex52.m1.1">M</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="120%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S3.Ex52.m1.5.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="true">[</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex52.m1.5.2">
                                <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid4"/>
                                  <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok name="underline" role="UNDERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>

                                      <XMApp>

                          </XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="script" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
<!--  %**** String Line 1400 **** -->                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p><text font="italic">with <Math mode="inline" tex="C\leq C_{d,{\ell}-1}{\delta}({\mathcal{M}})" text="C less= C _ (list@(d, ell - 1)) * delta * M" xml:id="S3.Thmcor3.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.Thmcor3.p1.m3.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.Thmcor3.p1.m3.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmcor3.p1.m3.1">d</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmcor3.p1.m3.2">
                              <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.Thmcor3.p1.m3.3"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmcor3.p1.m3.3">M</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, which can be bounded in terms of
<Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S3.Thmcor3.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\ell}" text="ell" xml:id="S3.Thmcor3.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{\mathcal{M}}" text="sigma _ M" xml:id="S3.Thmcor3.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <para xml:id="S3.SS5.p6">
        <p>It is worth noticing that the right-hand side in Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:C:elm-pd-dec"/>
involves best errors of approximation problems that may be considered the most
simplest ones involving polynomials and measuring the error in some
<Math mode="inline" tex="{L^{2}}" text="L ^ 2" xml:id="S3.SS5.p6.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-sense.</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:S:appl" xml:id="S4">
    <tags>
      <tag>4</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">4</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§4</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">4</tag>Two applications</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">4</tag>Two applications</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S4.p1">
      <p>The main novelty of the preceding section lies in the type of statements that
are proven. The goal of this section is to advocate its usefulness by
showing that it allows for simplifications or improvements in theory and
algorithms. Doing so, we focus on applications of the decoupling of elements
and, in order to cover various boundary conditions, we adopt the setting of
§<ref labelref="LABEL:S:best-errors"/>.</p>
    </para>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:S:Conv-ErrEst" xml:id="S4.SS1">
      <tags>
        <tag>4.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">4.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§4.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">4.1</tag>Convergence and error estimates</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">4.1</tag>Convergence and error estimates</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p1">
        <p>We start by reviewing some approximation results that play an important role in
the a priori error analysis of finite element methods.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p2">
        <p>A minimum requirement for a numerical method for a boundary value problem is
<!--  %**** String Line 1425 **** -->that the approximate solution converges to the exact one as the meshsize tends
to <Math mode="inline" tex="0" text="0" xml:id="S4.SS1.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. In case of a finite element method, a necessary (and also sufficient,
if for example the Céa Lemma holds) condition for this is that the best error
of the corresponding finite element space tends to <Math mode="inline" tex="0" text="0" xml:id="S4.SS1.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. It is instructive to
prove this well-known fact for continuous piecewise polynomial functions with
the help of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:elm-dec"/>.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" xml:id="S4.Thmthm1">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 4.1</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">4.1</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 4.1</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 4.1</text></tag> (Convergence).</title>
        <para xml:id="S4.Thmthm1.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">There holds</text></p>
          <equation xml:id="S4.Ex1">
            <Math mode="display" tex="E(v,{\mathcal{M}})\to 0\quad\text{as}\quad h{:=}\max_{{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}}h_{K%&#10;}\to 0" text="formulae@(E * open-interval@(v, M) to list@(0, [as]), h assign (maximum _ (K element-of M))@(h _ K) to 0)" xml:id="S4.Ex1.m1">

                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="quad" role="PUNCT"> </XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex1.m1.6">
                      <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>

                      <XMApp>
                        <XMApp scriptpos="mid">

                          <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="mid">max</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p><text font="italic">within a shape-regular family of meshes with <Math mode="inline" tex="(d-1)" text="d - 1" xml:id="S4.Thmthm1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-face connected stars.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <proof>
        <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
        <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p3">

                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="script" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>

                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>
                <MathBranch>
                  <td align="right"><Math tex="\displaystyle E(v,{\mathcal{M}})" text="E * open-interval@(v, M)" xml:id="S4.E1X.m2">

          </equationgroup>
          <p>which allows to conclude with a standard argument. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="{\epsilon}&gt;0" text="epsilon &gt; 0" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="epsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ϵ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be arbitrary.
Since <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{0}(\overline{\Omega})" text="C ^ 0 * overline@(Omega)" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p3.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m5.1">
                        <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is dense in <Math mode="inline" tex="{L^{2}}(\Omega)" text="L ^ 2 * Omega" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p3.m6.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m6.1">Ω</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, there exists <Math mode="inline" tex="g\in C^{0}(\overline{\Omega})^{d}" text="g element-of C ^ 0 * (overline@(Omega)) ^ d" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p3.m7.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m7.1">
                            <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                            <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\left\|{{\nabla}v-g}\right\|_{{\Omega}}}\leq{\epsilon}/3" text="(norm@(nabla@(v) - g)) _ Omega less= epsilon / 3" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p3.m8.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m8.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok name="nabla" role="OPERATOR">∇</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="epsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ϵ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
Thanks to <Math mode="inline" tex="{\left\|{\overline{f}}\right\|_{{\Omega}}}\leq{\left\|{f}\right\|_{{\Omega}}}" text="(norm@(overline@(f))) _ Omega less= (norm@(f)) _ Omega" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p3.m9.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m9.1">
                          <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p3.m9.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m9.2">f</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">∥</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, we derive</p>
          <equation>
            <Math mode="display" tex="\displaystyle{\left\|{{\nabla}v-\overline{{\nabla}v}}\right\|_{{\Omega}}}\leq{%&#10;\left\|{{\nabla}v-g}\right\|_{{\Omega}}}+{\left\|{g-\overline{g}}\right\|_{{%&#10;\Omega}}}+{\left\|{\overline{g-{\nabla}v}}\right\|_{{\Omega}}}\leq(2{\epsilon}%&#10;)/3+{\left\|{g-\overline{g}}\right\|_{{\Omega}}}" text="(norm@(nabla@(v) - overline@(nabla@(v)))) _ Omega less= (norm@(nabla@(v) - g)) _ Omega + (norm@(g - overline@(g))) _ Omega + (norm@(overline@(g - nabla@(v)))) _ Omega less= (2 * epsilon) / 3 + (norm@(g - overline@(g))) _ Omega" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m10">

                                <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m10.50">
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m10.30">2</XMTok>

                            </XMApp>

                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post10"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m10.36">∥</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m10.51">
                                  <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m10.38">-</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m10.37">g</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m10.39">
                                    <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
