                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMCell>
                    </XMRow>
                  </XMArray>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>and the last term can be made smaller <Math mode="inline" tex="{\epsilon}/3" text="epsilon / 3" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="epsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ϵ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for sufficiently small <Math mode="inline" tex="h" text="h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>,
because <Math mode="inline" tex="g" text="g" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is uniform continuous in view of the compactness of
<Math mode="inline" tex="\overline{\Omega}" text="overline@(Omega)" xml:id="S4.SS1.p3.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
∎</p>
        </para>
      </proof>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p4">
        <p>Notice that the first equality in (<ref labelref="LABEL:mv-bd"/>) corresponds to a special case
of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:pder-dec"/> and its combination with Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:elm-dec"/>
simplifies the following density argument in that it does not involve
derivatives.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p5">
        <p>Usually, the validity of a finite element method is theoretically
investigated by deriving a priori error estimates, quantifying the convergence
speed in terms of powers of <Math mode="inline" tex="h" text="h" xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Accordingly, such estimates for the best
error of the corresponding finite element space are of interest. These are
usually obtained by directly bounding the error of some interpolation operator
in terms of higher order Sobolev seminorms. Here we use Theorem
<ref labelref="LABEL:T:elm-dec"/> and</p>
        <equation xml:id="S4.Ex3">
          <Math mode="display" tex="{{\left|{{v}}\right|_{{{s},{2};{K}}}}}{:=}\begin{cases}\left(\sum_{|\alpha|=s}%&#10;{{\left\|{{\partial^{\alpha}v}}\right\|_{{0,{2};{K}}}}}^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2%&#10;}}&amp;\text{if }s\in{\mathbb{N}}\\&#10;(1-\theta)\left(\sum_{|\alpha|=\lfloor s\rfloor}\displaystyle\int_{K}\int_{K}%&#10;\frac{|\partial^{\alpha}v(x)-\partial^{\alpha}v(y)|^{2}}{|x-y|^{2\theta+d}}%&#10;\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}&amp;\text{otherwise,}\end{cases}" text="(absolute-value@(v)) _ (list@(s, 2, K)) assign cases@(((sum _ (absolute-value@(alpha) = s))@(((norm@((partial-differential ^ alpha)@(v))) _ (list@(0, 2, K))) ^ 2)) ^ (1 / 2), [if ] * s element-of N, (1 - theta) * ((sum _ (absolute-value@(alpha) = floor@(s)))@((integral _ K)@((integral _ K)@((absolute-value@((partial-differential ^ alpha)@(v) * x - (partial-differential ^ alpha)@(v) * y)) ^ 2 / (absolute-value@(x - y)) ^ (2 * theta + d))))) ^ (1 / 2), [otherwise,])" xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
<!--  %**** String Line 1500 **** -->                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Ex3.m1.8"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1.8">v</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Ex3.m1.5"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Ex3.m1.6"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Ex3.m1.7"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1.5">s</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1.6">2</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Ex3.m1.7">K</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="cases"/>

        <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="s&gt;0" text="s &gt; 0" xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> indicates the smoothness, <Math mode="inline" tex="\theta{:=}s-\lfloor s\rfloor" text="theta assign s - floor@(s)" xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
its fractional part and the sums are over all multi-indices of order <Math mode="inline" tex="\lfloor s\rfloor" text="floor@(s)" xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="floor"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p5.m4.1"/>

                  <XMTok name="rfloor" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⌋</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>; the factor <Math mode="inline" tex="(1-\theta)" text="1 - theta" xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p5.m5.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p5.m5.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>

            </XMath>
          </Math> is motivated by J. Bourgain et al. <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Bourgain.Brezis.Mironescu:01" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.</p>
      </para>
      <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:T:ErrEst" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2">
        <tags>
          <tag>Theorem 4.2</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">4.2</tag>
          <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 4.2</tag>
        </tags>
        <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 4.2</text></tag> (Error estimates).</title>
        <para xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in X" text="v element-of X" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> a target function, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}" text="M" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> be a mesh with <Math mode="inline" tex="(d-1)" text="d - 1" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m3.1">
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-face connected
stars and <Math mode="inline" tex="1\leq s\leq{\ell}+1" text="1 less= s less= ell + 1" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. If <Math mode="inline" tex="v_{|{K}}\in{H^{{s}}}({K})" text="v _ [|K] element-of H ^ s * K" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                      <XMArg rule="Subscript">
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMArg>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m5.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m5.1">K</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> for all
<Math mode="inline" tex="{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}" text="K element-of M" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, then</text></p>
          <equation xml:id="S4.Ex4">
            <Math mode="display" tex="E(v,{\mathcal{M}})\leq C\left(\sum_{{K}\in{\mathcal{M}}}h_{K}^{2(s-1)}{{\left|%&#10;{{v}}\right|_{{{s},{2};{K}}}}}^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}," text="E * open-interval@(v, M) less= C * ((sum _ (K element-of M))@((h _ K) ^ (2 * (s - 1)) * ((absolute-value@(v)) _ (list@(s, 2, K))) ^ 2)) ^ (1 / 2)" xml:id="S4.Ex4.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.Ex4.m1.8"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex4.m1.8">
                      <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
<!--  %**** String Line 1525 **** -->                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S4.Ex4.m1.5"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S4.Ex4.m1.6"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Ex4.m1.5">v</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Ex4.m1.6">M</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S4.Ex4.m1.8.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="true">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex4.m1.8.1">
                                <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid4"/>
                                  <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                      <XMDual>
                                        <XMRef idref="S4.Ex4.m1.1"/>
                                        <XMWrap>
                                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                          <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex4.m1.1">
                                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                          </XMApp>
                                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                        </XMWrap>
                                      </XMDual>
                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post6"/>
                                      <XMDual>
                                        <XMApp>
                                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                                          <XMRef idref="S4.Ex4.m1.7"/>
                                        </XMApp>
                                        <XMWrap>
                                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Ex4.m1.7">v</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                                        </XMWrap>
                                      </XMDual>
                                      <XMDual>
                                        <XMApp>
                                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                          <XMRef idref="S4.Ex4.m1.2"/>
                                          <XMRef idref="S4.Ex4.m1.3"/>
                                          <XMRef idref="S4.Ex4.m1.4"/>
                                        </XMApp>
                                        <XMWrap>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Ex4.m1.2">s</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.Ex4.m1.3">2</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Ex4.m1.4">K</XMTok>
                                        </XMWrap>
                                      </XMDual>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="true">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="script" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p><text font="italic">where <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> can be bounded in terms of <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\ell}" text="ell" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{\mathcal{M}}" text="sigma _ M" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="s" text="s" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m11">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.
If <Math mode="inline" tex="s\in{\mathbb{N}}" text="s element-of N" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m12">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, then</text></p>
          <equation xml:id="S4.Ex5">
            <Math mode="display" tex="C\leq\frac{s!}{(\lceil\frac{s}{d}\rceil!)^{d}}C_{P}^{s-1}\delta({\mathcal{M}})" text="C less= (sfactorial / (ceiling@(s / d))factorial ^ d) * (C _ P) ^ (s - 1) * delta * M" xml:id="S4.Ex5.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="factorial" role="POSTFIX">!</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.Ex5.m1.2"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex5.m1.2">
                              <XMTok meaning="factorial" role="POSTFIX">!</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="ceiling"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S4.Ex5.m1.1"/>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok name="lceil" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⌈</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex5.m1.1">
                                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok name="rceil" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⌉</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Ex5.m1.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Ex5.m1.3">M</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p><text font="italic">where <Math mode="inline" tex="C_{P}" text="C _ P" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m13">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is the optimal Poincaré constant for <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m14">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-simplices in <Math mode="inline" tex="{{\mathbb{R}}^{d}}" text="R ^ d" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m15">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</text></p>
        </para>
      </theorem>
      <proof>
        <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
        <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p6">
          <p>Combine Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:elm-dec"/> and the Bramble-Hilbert inequality</p>
          <equation labels="LABEL:BrambleHilbert" xml:id="S4.E2">
            <tags>
              <tag>(4.2)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">4.2</tag>
            </tags>
            <Math mode="display" tex="e(v,{K})\leq Ch_{K}^{s-1}{{\left|{{v}}\right|_{{{s},{2};{K}}}}}" text="e * open-interval@(v, K) less= C * (h _ K) ^ (s - 1) * (absolute-value@(v)) _ (list@(s, 2, K))" xml:id="S4.E2.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.E2.m1.4"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.E2.m1.5"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.E2.m1.4">v</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.E2.m1.5">K</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.E2.m1.6"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.E2.m1.6">v</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.E2.m1.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.E2.m1.2"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.E2.m1.3"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.E2.m1.1">s</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.E2.m1.2">2</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.E2.m1.3">K</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="C" text="C" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> depends on <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\ell}" text="ell" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="s" text="s" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and the shape coefficient of <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-simplex
<Math mode="inline" tex="{K}" text="K" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. The latter follows, e.g., from <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Dupont.Scott:80" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorems 3.2 and
6.1]</cite> and a standard scaling argument. The explicit constant
for <Math mode="inline" tex="s\in{\mathbb{N}}" text="s element-of N" xml:id="S4.SS1.p6.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is ensured by choosing a polynomial that allows an iterative
<!--  %**** String Line 1550 **** -->application of the Poincaré inequality; see R. Verfürth
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Verfuerth:99" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, §3]</cite>.
∎</p>
        </para>
      </proof>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p7">
        <p>We compare the bound of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:ErrEst"/> and those available via
Lagrange and Scott-Zhang interpolation <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Scott.Zhang:90" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, §4]</cite>; error bounds
via Clément interpolation <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Clement:75" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> coincide with the latter ones for
homogeneous Dirichlet boundary conditions.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p8">
        <p>Doing so, we fix a mesh and vary through functions – a viewpoint differing
from the usual one where a function is fixed and meshes vary. Notice that in
the former case to be considered the most convenient choice of <Math mode="inline" tex="s" text="s" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not
necessarily the maximal one; indeed, the product <Math mode="inline" tex="h_{K}^{s}{{\left|{{v}}\right|_{{{s},{2};{K}}}}}" text="(h _ K) ^ s * (absolute-value@(v)) _ (list@(s, 2, K))" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p8.m2.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m2.4">v</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p8.m2.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p8.m2.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p8.m2.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m2.1">s</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m2.2">2</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m2.3">K</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> may not be monotone decreasing in <Math mode="inline" tex="s" text="s" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for certain
functions. This is closely related to the following drawback of the bounds via
Lagrange interpolation for <Math mode="inline" tex="d\geq 2" text="d &gt;= 2" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Consider a sequence of functions
<Math mode="inline" tex="(v_{n})_{n}" text="v _ n _ n" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p8.m5.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m5.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="{H^{{\lfloor d/2\rfloor+1}}}(\Omega)" text="H ^ (floor@(d / 2) + 1) * Omega" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="floor"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p8.m6.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="lfloor" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⌊</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m6.1">
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="rfloor" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⌋</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p8.m6.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m6.2">Ω</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> converging to a function not
better than <Math mode="inline" tex="{H^{{d/2}}}(\Omega)" text="H ^ (d / 2) * Omega" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p8.m7.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m7.1">Ω</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then any bound via Lagrange interpolation
blows up, while those of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:ErrEst"/> and via Scott-Zhang
interpolation remain bounded for suitable <Math mode="inline" tex="s\in{[{1},{{d/2}}]}" text="s element-of closed-interval@(1, d / 2)" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p8.m8.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p8.m8.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m8.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p8.m8.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p9">
        <p>On the other hand, bounds via Lagrange interpolation can be readily derived
in terms of broken Sobolev seminorms on elements; see, e.g.,
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Brenner.Scott:08" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, (4.4.20)]</cite> and modify the last three steps in its
proof. While Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:ErrEst"/> shares this property, the bounds via
<!--  %**** String Line 1575 **** -->Scott-Zhang interpolation <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Scott.Zhang:90" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> involve regularity across
element boundaries. The broken Sobolev norms on elements have the following
advantage: If <Math mode="inline" tex="E(v,{\mathcal{M}})=0" text="E * open-interval@(v, M) = 0" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p9.m1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p9.m1.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m1.1">v</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m1.2">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, then the bounds of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:ErrEst"/> and
Lagrange interpolation also vanish, while those via Scott-Zhang interpolation
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Scott.Zhang:90" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> do not vanish for <Math mode="inline" tex="s\in{{]}1,{3/2}{[}}" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and are not
applicable, i.e. are <Math mode="inline" tex="\infty" text="infinity" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, for <Math mode="inline" tex="s\geq 3/2" text="s &gt;= 3 / 2" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> whenever <Math mode="inline" tex="v" text="v" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has non-constant
gradient. Similarly as before, this has its counterparts for smooth functions.
To illustrate this, let <Math mode="inline" tex="(v_{n})_{n}" text="v _ n _ n" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p9.m6.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m6.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a sequence of functions in
<Math mode="inline" tex="{H^{{{\ell}+1}}}(\Omega)" text="H ^ (ell + 1) * Omega" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p9.m7.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m7.1">Ω</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and consider various conditions ensuring convergence to
a function in <Math mode="inline" tex="{S}({\mathcal{M}})" text="S * M" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p9.m8.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m8.1">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with non-constant gradient. If <Math mode="inline" tex="E(v_{n},{\mathcal{M}})\to 0" text="E * open-interval@(v _ n, M) to 0" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p9.m9.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p9.m9.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m9.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m9.1">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, then also the right-hand side of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:elm-dec"/> tends to <Math mode="inline" tex="0" text="0" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
If additionally the restrictions <Math mode="inline" tex="v_{n}{}_{|{K}}" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp role="FLOATSUBSCRIPT" scriptpos="2">
                <XMArg rule="Subscript">
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                </XMArg>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> converge in <Math mode="inline" tex="{H^{{s}}}({K})" text="H ^ s * K" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.SS1.p9.m12.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m12.1">K</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
for some <Math mode="inline" tex="1&lt;s\leq{\ell}+1" text="1 less s less= ell + 1" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, then the corresponding bound of Theorem
<ref labelref="LABEL:T:ErrEst"/> tends to <Math mode="inline" tex="0" text="0" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The same holds for bounds of Lagrange
interpolation, but only <Math mode="inline" tex="s\in{{]{{d/2}}},{{{\ell}+1}]}}" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are admissible. The
situation for bounds via Scott-Zhang interpolation is different: if <Math mode="inline" tex="1&lt;s&lt;3/2" text="1 less s less 3 / 2" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
then the corresponding bound does not tend to <Math mode="inline" tex="0" text="0" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and if <Math mode="inline" tex="3/2\leq s\leq{\ell}+1" text="3 / 2 less= s less= ell + 1" xml:id="S4.SS1.p9.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, it even blows up.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS1.p10">
        <p>Summarizing, one may say that the approach via Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:elm-dec"/>
combines advantages of the available bounds for both Lagrange interpolation and
interpolation of non-smooth functions. In particular, for
<Math mode="inline" tex="1&lt;s\leq d/2" text="1 less s less= d / 2" xml:id="S4.SS1.p10.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="d\geq 3" text="d &gt;= 3" xml:id="S4.SS1.p10.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the error bounds in terms of piecewise
regularity seem to be new. Bounds in terms of broken regularity are useful
also in the context of surface finite element methods (SFEM); see
<!--  %**** String Line 1600 **** -->F. Camacho and A. Demlow <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Camacho.Demlow:P" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:S:tree-approx" xml:id="S4.SS2">
      <tags>
        <tag>4.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">4.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§4.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">4.2</tag>Adaptive tree approximation of gradients</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">4.2</tag>Adaptive tree approximation of gradients</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS2.p1">
        <p>The upper bound of the global best error in Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:T:ErrEst"/> locally
combines meshsize and higher order derivatives. This suggests that, for a
given target function, certain meshes a more convenient than others.
I. Babuška and W. C. Rheinboldt <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Babuska.Rheinboldt:78a" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> formally
derive the following criteria, also called equidistribution principle: a mesh
minimizing the aforementioned upper bound subject to a fixed number of elements
equidistributes the element contributions, e.g., <Math mode="inline" tex="h_{K}{{\left|{{v}}\right|_{{{2},{2};{K}}}}}" text="h _ K * (absolute-value@(v)) _ (list@(2, 2, K))" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS2.p1.m1.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m1.4">v</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="true">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS2.p1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS2.p1.m1.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.SS2.p1.m1.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m1.1">2</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m1.2">2</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m1.3">K</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> does not depend on <Math mode="inline" tex="K\in{K}" text="K element-of K" xml:id="S4.SS2.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Obviously this
requires in general graded meshes.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS2.p2">
        <p>An algorithmically simple way of constructing graded meshes arises from a
prescribed rule for subdividing elements, which induces a tree structure. An
example of this was already in 1967 studied by S. Birman and M. Solomyak
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Birman.Solomyak:67" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. For continuous piecewise polynomial functions over
conforming simplicial meshes, one can use bisection with recursive completion;
for an overview of this technique, see e.g. Nochetto et al. <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Nochetto.Siebert.Veeser:09" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, §4]</cite>. Although recursive bisection limits
mesh flexibility, in particular mesh grading, the discussion in R. DeVore
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="DeVore:98" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, §6]</cite> and the results of P. Binev et al. <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Binev.Dahmen.DeVore.Petrushev:02" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> reveal that the regularity dictating
the asymptotic balance of global best error and number of degree of freedoms is
<!--  %**** String Line 1625 **** -->close to the best possible one. In particular, the global best <Math mode="inline" tex="H^{1}" text="H ^ 1" xml:id="S4.SS2.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-error of
suitably graded two-dimensional meshes decays like <Math mode="inline" tex="\#{\mathcal{M}}^{-\frac{1}{2}}" text="# * M ^ (- 1 / 2)" xml:id="S4.SS2.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">#</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="script" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> if
<Math mode="inline" tex="u\in{W^{{2},{p}}}(\Omega)" text="u element-of W ^ (list@(2, p)) * Omega" xml:id="S4.SS2.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.SS2.p2.m3.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.SS2.p2.m3.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.SS2.p2.m3.1">2</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS2.p2.m3.2">p</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS2.p2.m3.3"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS2.p2.m3.3">Ω</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="1&lt;p\leq 2" text="1 less p less= 2" xml:id="S4.SS2.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>; notice that the latter is weaker
than the requirement <Math mode="inline" tex="u\in{H^{2}}(\Omega)" text="u element-of H ^ 2 * Omega" xml:id="S4.SS2.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.SS2.p2.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.SS2.p2.m5.1">Ω</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> corresponding to the decay rate with
quasi-uniform meshes and that <Math mode="inline" tex="p=1" text="p = 1" xml:id="S4.SS2.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> corresponds to a optimal Sobolev embedding.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS2.p3">
        <p>The goal of this section is to derive and analyze an instance of the tree
algorithm by P. Binev and R. DeVore <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Binev.DeVore:04" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> that constructs near
best bisection meshes for the approximation of gradients with piecewise
polynomial functions. It may be used for coarsening in adaptive algorithms
iterating the main steps</p>
        <equation xml:id="S4.Ex6">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\texttt{error reduction}\to\texttt{sparsity adjustment}." text="[error reduction] to [sparsity adjustment]" xml:id="S4.Ex6.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.Ex6.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex6.m1.1">
                    <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                    <XMText><text font="typewriter">error reduction</text></XMText>
                    <XMText><text font="typewriter">sparsity adjustment</text></XMText>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Interestingly, this scheme can be applied also if a good a posteriori error
estimator is not available. It includes algorithms like in
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Binev.Dahmen.DeVore:04" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, §8]</cite> and algorithms that are based upon
discretizing the steps of an infinite-dimensional solver. Moreover, the
following algorithm can be used to compute an approximation of the best error of
bisection meshes with a given number of elements. Such approximations are of
interest as a benchmark for corresponding adaptive finite element methods.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S4.SS2.p4">
        <p>In order to introduce the algorithm and to state its main property, we need the
following notation. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}_{0}" text="M _ 0" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be an initial mesh of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega" text="Omega" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> that is
admissible for bisection with recursive completion; see, e.g., <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Nochetto.Siebert.Veeser:09" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Assumption
11.1 on p. 453]</cite>. Denote by
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{M}}^{\prime}" text="M ^ prime" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> the set of all meshes that can be generated by bisections without
completion from <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}_{0}" text="M _ 0" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>; these meshes are not necessarily conforming and
each one correponds to a subtree in the master tree given by <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}_{0}" text="M _ 0" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and the
bisection rule of a single <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-simplex. Moreover, denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{M}}" text="M" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> the
subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{M}}^{\prime}" text="M ^ prime" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of all meshes that are conforming. If
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}^{\prime}\in{\mathbb{M}}^{\prime}" text="M ^ prime element-of M ^ prime" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a possibly non-conforming mesh, denote by
<Math mode="inline" tex="\texttt{complete}({\mathcal{M}}^{\prime})" text="[complete] * M ^ prime" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMText><text font="typewriter">complete</text></XMText>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.SS2.p4.m10.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m10.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> the smallest refinement of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}^{\prime}" text="M ^ prime" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathbb{M}}" text="M" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Since <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{M}}_{0}" text="M _ 0" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is admissible, Binev et al. <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Binev.Dahmen.DeVore:04" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 2.4]</cite> if
<Math mode="inline" tex="d=2" text="d = 2" xml:id="S4.SS2.p4.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and R. Stevenson <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Stevenson:08" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 6.1]</cite> otherwise ensure the
non-obvious relationship</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:complete" xml:id="S4.E3">
          <tags>
            <tag>(4.3)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">4.3</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="\#\texttt{complete}({\mathcal{M}}^{\prime})-\#{\mathcal{M}}_{0}\leq{{C_{\text{%&#10;cmpl}}}}(\#{\mathcal{M}}^{\prime}-\#{\mathcal{M}}_{0})" text="# * [complete] * M ^ prime - # * M _ 0 less= C _ [cmpl] * (# * M ^ prime - # * M _ 0)" xml:id="S4.E3.m1">

                  </XMApp>

                <XMApp>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.E3.m1.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.E3.m1.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>

                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">#</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>

                            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>

                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>

                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
